event: Beginning of Olmec civilization, considered the first major Mesoamerican culture.
Zapotec civilization emerges in the Valley of Oaxaca.
Classic period of Teotihuacan, a major urban center near modern Mexico City.
Decline of Teotihuacan; rise of city-states like Monte Albán and El Tajín.
Toltec civilization flourishes in central Mexico.
Founding of Tenochtitlán by the Mexica (Aztecs).
Formation of the Aztec Triple Alliance, leading to Aztec Empire dominance.
Hernán Cortés arrives on the coast of Mexico and begins the Spanish conquest.
Fall of Tenochtitlán; beginning of Spanish colonial rule.
Creation of the Viceroyalty of New Spain.
Miguel Hidalgo issues the Grito de Dolores, starting the Mexican War of Independence.
Mexico gains independence from Spain.
Federal Constitution of the United Mexican States enacted.
Texas declares independence from Mexico.
Mexican-American War begins.
Treaty of Guadalupe Hidalgo ends war; Mexico cedes large territories to the U.S.
Mexican forces defeat the French at the Battle of Puebla on May 5 (Cinco de Mayo).
French install Emperor Maximilian I during Second Mexican Empire.
Republic restored under Benito Juárez; Maximilian executed.
Porfirio Díaz seizes power, beginning the Porfiriato era.
Mexican Revolution begins against Díaz’s dictatorship.
New Mexican Constitution adopted, still in effect today.
Founding of the Institutional Revolutionary Party (PRI), which dominates for decades.
Tlatelolco massacre occurs before the Olympics in Mexico City.
Major earthquake devastates Mexico City, killing thousands.
NAFTA (North American Free Trade Agreement) takes effect; Zapatista uprising in Chiapas.
End of PRI dominance with election of Vicente Fox from PAN.
Government launches war against drug cartels, escalating violence.
Andrés Manuel López Obrador (AMLO) elected president with a landslide victory.
COVID-19 pandemic severely impacts Mexico’s health system and economy.
